articles.author: Patrick Kingsley
articles.title: Ukraine War Sets Off Europe’s Fastest Migration in Decades - The New York Times
articles.description: At least 660,000 people, mostly women and children, fled Ukraine in the five days after Russia invaded — the most intense wave of European migration since at least the 1990s.
articles.content: If the displacement stretches out for years, it would present long-term challenges for Ukraine, which would face a brain drain of rare proportions, and for host countries where resources are limited … [+1209 chars]

articles.author: Wojciech Kość
articles.title: Ukrainian refugees ‘shaking in fear’ look for shelter in Poland - POLITICO Europe
articles.description: Situation has the potential to become the EU’s worst-ever humanitarian crisis.
articles.content:
PRZEMYL, Poland  A week ago, Helena Arykul was a sales manager in the Black Sea city of Odesa. Now shes a refugee in Poland.
Russia’s invasion of Ukraine sent her fleeing westward.

articles.title: Wallace and Daly vote for long delay on Ukraine's chance of joining EU - Independent.ie

articles.title: Europe's joint Mars mission with Russia postponed by war - 1News
articles.description: While Europe has its own rockets to put satellites into orbit, it relies on Russian and American partners to send astronauts into space.
articles.content:
The launch of a joint Europe-Russia mission to Mars this year is now very unlikely due to sanctions linked to the war in Ukraine, the European Space Agency said on Tuesday.
